basics.name: Mishalyn Mei Ilmeng
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2027. My professional goal is to build a career in software development or data science.

skills.name: Toolsets/OS
keywords: MacOS, Visual Studio Code, Unix, Microsoft Excel

highlights: Serve as a personal stylist for customers by recommending eyewear based on their personal needs and current trends.
Manage daily retail operations, including inventory management, point-of-sale transactions, selling merchandise, and customer service.
Perform eyewear adjustments and repairs with precision and care.

awards.title: Mānoa Academic Merit Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to Hawai’i residents applying as first-year, degree-seeking students with a high school cumulative GPA of 3.6 or higher.

awards.title: University of Hawai'i at M​ānoa Dean's List
awards.summary: Distinction rewarded to undergraduate students who earn a semester GPA of 3.5 or higher on 12+ credits and do not receive grades of NC (no credit), W (withdrawn), I (incomplete), F (failure).
